etymology.description: 見(見) (jiàn, 'see') + 王(王) (wáng, 'king') = see the presence of a ruler -> appear
etymology.interpretation: The character uses 見(見) (jiàn, 'see') to suggest visibility or presence, combined with 王(王) (wáng, 'king') to imply the notion of a notable presence or appearance. This effectively conveys the idea of 'appearing' or 'being present.'
etymology.simplification: 現(現)→现(現): The component 王(王) (wáng, 'king') is streamlined for simplicity.

examples.chinese: 他突然现身(他突然現身)。
黄昏时分(黃昏時分)，他现身于云中(他現身於雲中)。
examples.pinyin: Huánghūn shí fēn, tā xiàn shēn yú yún zhōng.
examples.english: At dusk, he appeared among the clouds.

examples.chinese: 真相现出来了(真相現出來了)。
